thread.title: Sunderland defender Sebastian Coates permanently joins Sporting Lisbon after initial loan spell
thread.title_full: Sunderland defender Sebastian Coates permanently joins Sporting Lisbon after initial loan spell

author: gboulton
title: Sunderland defender Sebastian Coates permanently joins Sporting Lisbon after initial loan spell
text:
Sporting land black cat Sunderland defender Sebastian Coates permanently joins Sporting Lisbon after initial loan spell 
Former Black Cats defender made his move to Portugal permanent after joining them on loan in January last year by George Boulton Comments SEBASTIAN COATES has made his loan move from Sunderland to Sporting Lisbon permanent. 
The Uruguayan international made 38 appearances for the Portuguese side after initially joining them on loan last January. EPA 5 Sebastian Coates has lined up against Real Madrid since joining Sporting Lisbon 
The 23-year-old joined Sunderland from Liverpool in 2014, becoming Dick Advocaat’s first signing as Black Cats boss. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Sunderland news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary. The Uruguayan international made 32 appearances for Sunderland before joining Lisbon on loan. The defender’s current deal will expire in 2022 and now features a £38.5million release clause. 
Coates has been an important player for Lisbon so far this season and has appeared 18 times in the league, scoring three goals and providing two assists. EPA Coates has scored three goals for Lisbon this season Reuters The 26-year-old made 32 appearances for Sunderland Related stories Real Madrid in stunning plot to sign Manchester City's out-of-favour striker Sergio Aguero this summer Buy M'Baye Watford will have to shatter transfer record and pay £13.5m for M'Baye Niang if he scores ten goals while on loan Hart's new home? Man City outcast Joe Hart will be West Ham's top transfer target as Slaven Bilic lines up £15m bid You're in Rayo trouble La Liga threaten to sue Rayo Vallecano for terminating 'neo-Nazi' striker Roman Zozulya's loan Swan song Swansea boss Paul Clement reveals he tried to sign Chelsea legend Frank Lampard before retirement ON THE MOVE Chelsea plot a mega summer spending spree, Dortmund identify new striker and Arsenal target wonderkid PLATE OF LAM? Erik Lamela looks set to quit Tottenham and join River Plate as he 'has family issues back in Argentina' REVOLVING DOR Dortmund expected to replace Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang with Bilbao's £43m ace Inaki Williams 
Jorge Jesus’ side are currently third in the Primeira Liga and trail league leaders Benfica by seven points. 
Sporting Lisbon also confirmed a new deal for striker Gelson Martins, who signed a new deal until 2022. 
As his deal also includes a hefty release clause worth £51.5million – after being linked with Manchester United, Chelsea, Real Madrid and Barcelona . Action Images The defender arrived at Sunderland after struggling to break into Liverpool’s first team Sunderland 0-0 Tottenham : Spurs drop crucial title race points as Black Cats move off bottom Action Images
